source_sentence: 吳月支國居士支謙譯
translation: Wu Yuezhi guo Jushi Zhi Qian's translation

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，佛與五百沙門俱，遊於越祇，到鼓車城外樹下坐。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, when the Buddha was staying in Vṛji together with five hundred śramaṇas, he came to sit under a tree outside the city of Kuśinagara.

source_sentence: 比聚有豪賢梵志，名費迦沙，明曉經書星宿運度，所問皆答。
translation: In the assembly, there was an eloquent brahman named Feiqiasha, who explained the dawn scriptures and stars and constellations as they traveled, and he answered all his questions.

source_sentence: 有五百弟子，弟子中第一者，名阿颰。
translation: He had five hundred disciples, the first of whom was named Anuruddha.

source_sentence: 阿颰問師言：「今有佛來，人稱其德，名蓋天地，不識斯何人也？」
translation: Akṣobhya asked the teacher, Now that a Buddha has come, people praise his virtue and name cover heaven and earth, but they don't know who he is.

source_sentence: 費迦沙言：「吾聞是釋種國王太子，厥興無師，自著經化。」
translation: Kāśyapa said, I've heard that this is the prince of the king of the Śākyas who arises without a teacher and follows the sūtras and transforms himself.

source_sentence: 阿颰言：「若無師者，名譽何美？
translation: Ānanda said, If there's no teacher, what's the beauty of fame?

source_sentence: 又國王子，多憍婬好樂，安肯塗行降志乞食，誨人不倦？
translation: Furthermore, the prince of the kingdom had many delights and pleasures, so he was willing to coarse his practice and subdue his intention to beg for food, teaching people without tire.

source_sentence: 將是真人乎！
translation: How could he be a real person?

source_sentence: 願師可行觀其道德。」
translation: May the teacher practice and observe his morality.

source_sentence: 費迦沙言：「不然，我世豪賢，聰叡多才，彼為新出，義當來謁，吾不宜往。」
translation: Kāśyapa said, Otherwise, I'm a worldly man of great intelligence and wisdom who's clever and talented, and he's newly born; it's appropriate for me to come to see him, but I won't go.

source_sentence: 阿颰言：「我聞天帝釋，與第七梵，皆下事之，所教弟子，悉得五通，
translation: Ānanda said: I have heard that Sakka the ruler of gods and Brahmā the seventh, as well as Indra and all the deities of the assembly, serve each other. The disciples they teach are endowed with the five supernatural knowledges.

source_sentence: 輕舉能飛，達視洞聽，知人意志，及生所從來，死所趣向。
translation: He knows the minds of people, their intentions, the places where they are born and the paths that lead them to death.

source_sentence: 此蓋天師，何肯來謁！」
translation: How dare you come to see this celestial teacher!

source_sentence: 費迦沙言：「經說帝王生子，有三十二相者，立即當為飛行皇帝，王四天下，
translation: Vaiśeṣika said, The sūtra says that if the emperor were to give birth to a son with the thirty-two marks, he would immediately become the flying emperor and rule over the four quarters of the earth.

source_sentence: 自然七寶，一金輪寶、二白象寶、三紺馬寶、四玉女寶、五神珠寶、六理家寶、七賢將寶，
translation: There were seven treasures of their own accord: the first was the golden wheel treasure, the second the white elephant treasure, the third the dark blue horse treasure, the fourth the jadelike queen treasure, the fifth the divine gem treasure, the sixth the royal treasure, and the seventh the general treasure.

source_sentence: 當有千子，皆才明勇武，一人當千，兵杖不用，其世泰平。
translation: There will be a thousand sons, all of whom will be endowed with knowledge and bravery. One man will be one thousand in number; they will not use weapons to sustain peace and stability in the world.

source_sentence: 若棄天下，當為自然佛，以無為為化，度人得道。
translation: If he renounces the world, he'll become a natural buddha who transforms himself into nonproductivity and saves people to attain the path.

source_sentence: 彼豈是耶？
translation: Is that true?

source_sentence: 汝且往觀。
translation: You must go and observe it.

source_sentence: 有此相者，其審是佛，吾當事之。」
translation: If someone has this characteristic, they'll judge it to be the Buddha, and I will serve them.

source_sentence: 阿颰言：「願與同志共行。」
translation: Akṣobhya said, May I go with my comrades?

source_sentence: 師言：「大善。」
translation: The teacher said, Very good.

source_sentence: 即與五百弟子俱，到皆下車揖讓佛。
translation: He was accompanied by five hundred disciples, all of whom descended from their chariots and bowed to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛使就座，五百人盡坐，獨阿颰左右彷徨，微觀佛相。
translation: When the Buddha’s envoy had taken his seat, all five hundred bhikṣus sat there. They wandered on their left and right sides alone in solitary assemblies, observing the Buddha’s features only indirectly.

source_sentence: 佛知其意，亦起併行，阿颰住，佛亦住。
translation: Knowing his intention, the Buddha also arose and traveled together. Akṣobhya abided, and so did the Buddha.

source_sentence: 阿颰坐，佛亦坐。
translation: Akṣobhya sat, and so did the Buddha.

source_sentence: 阿颰乃問佛言：「本事何等道？
translation: Ānanda then asked the Buddha, What path did you practice in the past?

source_sentence: 除鬚髮、披袈裟、持鉢何應？」
translation: What's the point of removing your hair, wearing a monk's robe, and carrying a bowl?

source_sentence: 佛言：「吾求道已來，歷世久遠，不可稱紀。
translation: The Buddha said, Since I've pursued the path for a long time, it can't be measured.

source_sentence: 常奉諸佛，行菩薩道，所事師友，無復央數。
translation: They always revered the buddhas and practiced the bodhisattva path. The teachers and friends they attended were countless in number.

source_sentence: 除鬚髮者，為終身戒，捐棄貪愛，無復飾好。
translation: He who removes his hair and beard observes the precepts for the rest of his life, abandoning craving and no longer adorning himself.

source_sentence: 使人不欲己，己亦不欲人。
translation: A messenger doesn't want himself, and he doesn't want people.

source_sentence: 袈裟法服，古聖旌表，解釋垢結，無復世念。
translation: The monastic robes and religious robes are enshrined in ancient scriptures. They explain the defiled fetters of ignorance without further worldly thoughts.

source_sentence: 鉢為應器，宜道人用，節身約省，非義不受也。
translation: The bowl is a suitable vessel for religious practitioners to use, but it's not the meaning that they don't accept it.

source_sentence: 斯皆無為清淨之像。
translation: These are all pure images of nonexistence.

source_sentence: 今我作佛，為天下師，自恣汝意，欲問勿難。」
translation: Now that I've become a buddha and a teacher of the world, I'll do as you wish, so don't make it difficult to ask questions.

source_sentence: 阿颰言：「我等所事師，費迦沙，世世聰明，名昇遐遠，又是梵種，特勝餘人。
translation: Ānanda said: The teacher whom we serve is Fekaṣa. He is intelligent and worldly, renowned for his ascent into the far-off realms of rebirth. He belongs to the brahmin class, surpassing all other people.

source_sentence: 天下雖貴為王，亦有不仁，而我種者，獨不好殺。」
translation: Although the world is noble as a king, there are also some who aren't benevolent, but those of our castes won't kill them alone.

source_sentence: 佛言：「吾本用惡殺故，求佛無上正真之道。
translation: The Buddha said, In the past, I used bad killing to seek the unsurpassed true path of buddhahood.

source_sentence: 汝梵志種，但口貴仁，雖手不殺，心皆有殺。
translation: You companions of the priestly community, however, are noble in speech and kind. Even if you do not kill with your hands, you will have killing in your mind.

source_sentence: 今我為佛，身、口、意淨，一切不殺。
translation: Now that I am a buddha, my body, speech, and mind are pure, and I won't kill anyone.

source_sentence: 用天下人皆好殺故，教以仁義。」
translation: It's because the people of the world are fond of killing and teach it with kindness and righteousness.

source_sentence: 阿颰問言：「今佛棄捐妻子，自絕種嗣，殆不若我師，世世繼嗣也。」
translation: Akṣobhya asked, Now that the Buddha has abandoned his wife and cut off his own seeds to inherit them, it's almost as if he were my teacher, who will inherit them from generation to generation.

source_sentence: 佛言：「天下人狀，本末各異，眾人前世，曾為我子，吾亦曾為一切人子，
translation: The Buddha said: Formerly all the people of the world were my heirs, but I was also the heir of all the people.

source_sentence: 會輙有離，種姓無常，或時冤仇相從為親、或時親屬復為冤仇，因緣離合，
translation: Sometimes enemies sometimes follow each other as their relatives, sometimes their kinsmen are also enemies. Their causes and conditions are free from one another.

source_sentence: 一切如幻。
translation: Everything is illusory.

source_sentence: 父母妻子本非我親，吾亦非彼有，世人但以是我、非我而為罪惡，為後受苦。
translation: Their parents, wives, and children are not originally self or relatives of mine, nor is the self that exists there. People simply commit evil because they think it's self or not self, and they experience suffering later.

source_sentence: 昔我古世時，曾為剎利王，名為鼓摩床，有四子，一名郁鉗、二名虔尼、三名度、四名淳。
translation: In ancient times I was once the king of the kṣatriyas. My name was Kumāratna and had four sons: one, Ucchuṣa; two, Jīvaka; three, Sadāparvata; and four, Samantabhadra.

source_sentence: 王尚未崩，四子爭位，王聞愁憂，念四子爭，當殺人民，即委國東去，
translation: Before the demise of the king, when his four sons were about to seek power, the king was grieved and thought that they would kill the people. So he entrusted his kingdom to the eastern part of the country.

source_sentence: 行行自念：『人生無幾，無憂乃長，今我為王，欲得子姓，既已有子，
translation: He thought to himself, “I am the king now. I wish to have a family name but my son is already alive.

source_sentence: 還欲相伐，有嗣如是，何益於人？
translation: What advantage would it be to the people if they wanted to attack each other and had an heir like this?

source_sentence: 吾不忍見，恐殺無辜，但當捨家作沙門耳。』
translation: I can't bear to see it; I'm afraid I'll kill without guilt, but I'll leave home and become a monk.'

source_sentence: 即北入山，就道人迦比校止草廬。
translation: He entered the mountain to the north and stayed in a hermitage at Kapilavastu, where he practiced Buddhism.

source_sentence: 又有道人摩離，王問其本：『何緣學道？』
translation: Again, there was another Daoist priest named Māra, and the king asked his source, 'What's the reason for training in the path?'

source_sentence: 摩離自說：『娶妻無子，顏慙諸家，故作沙門。』
translation: Mālya said to himself, 'I married my wife without a child and became a monk because I'm deceiving all the houses in my family.'

source_sentence: 王言：『異哉！
translation: The king said, 'That's strange!

source_sentence: 吾為國王，有子四人，身尚未死，而子國亂，不忍見之，故為道耳。』
translation: I'm the king of my country, and there are four children whose bodies haven't died yet, but their countries are in turmoil, so I can't bear to see them; therefore, it's a path.'

source_sentence: 摩離意解，乃遂精進。
translation: When Mālī understood his mind, he then made effort.

source_sentence: 如是，阿颰，正使子賢，父老病亡，子不能却。
translation: Thus, Akṣobhya, the correct messenger, the wise son, whose father was old and sick, couldn't get rid of him.

source_sentence: 生時為惡，死入地獄，子不能代。
translation: When he's born, it's bad, and when he dies, he goes to hell, but his son can't replace him.

source_sentence: 用是故，我常以慈心救濟人物，道成得佛，度脫天下。」
translation: Because of this, I always rescue people with compassion and the path becomes a buddha and liberates the world.

source_sentence: 阿颰言：「佛為難及。
translation: Akṣobhya said, It's difficult to reach the Buddha.

source_sentence: 今天下有四種人，君子、梵志、田家、工伎，獨我梵種，為真且貴。
translation: Today, there are four kinds of people below us: gentlemen, priests, farmers, artisans, and craftsmen. I alone am the only brahmin among them; they are true and valuable.

source_sentence: 其餘三輩，皆事我種。」
translation: The other three groups of people all serve the self-nature.

source_sentence: 佛言：「假使汝種為真貴者，儻婦無子，婢而生男，當舉之不？」
translation: The Buddha said, Suppose you're a true noble person of your family, and if a woman with sexual misconduct has no child and a maid gives birth to a boy, will you raise him?

source_sentence: 曰：「當舉之。」
translation: He said, I'll lift it up.

source_sentence: 「今汝祖母，現取婢子為後，可為真貴耶？」
translation: Now, your grandmother, can you take the maidservant as a follower and make him truly valuable?

source_sentence: 阿颰默然，五百弟子，皆起住言：「瞿曇沙門，何毀我種！
translation: Akṣobhya remained silent, and the five hundred disciples all stood up and said, Gautama ascetic, why would you disparage me?

source_sentence: 阿颰才智，亦能相難。」
translation: The abhidharma's ability and wisdom can also make it difficult.

source_sentence: 佛言：「皆默然。
translation: The Buddha said, They're all silent.

source_sentence: 若其才智，當自辯之。」
translation: If he has the ability and wisdom, he'll explain it for himself.

source_sentence: 佛問其祖，至三無對。
translation: The Buddha asked his ancestor, Up to the point where he had no answer in three.

source_sentence: 金剛力士，舉大杵言：「佛重問汝，何故不對？」
translation: The Vajrapāṇi warrior raised his great vajra and said, Why didn't the Buddha ask you again, why didn't he answer?

source_sentence: 阿颰懼曰：「實如佛言。」
translation: Ānanda was frightened and said, It's really like the Buddha's words.

source_sentence: 五百人言：「佛聖智明，阿颰母者，信釋家婢。
translation: The five hundred people said, The Buddha's noble wisdom is clear, and the mother Akṣobhya believes in the maidservants of the Śākya family.

source_sentence: 我等從今，請不復敬。」
translation: From now on, we won't honor him again.

source_sentence: 佛言：「不然。
translation: The Buddha said, No.

source_sentence: 世或母賤，而子賢貴，阿颰賢人，不可毀也。
translation: Some people in the world may regard their mothers as inferior but their children as noble. The wise and virtuous abhidharma should not be disparaged.

source_sentence: 若使梵種娶剎利女，生子長大，當學父家？
translation: If a Brahmā takes the kṣatriya woman and gives birth to a child who grows up, should he train in his father's home?

source_sentence: 學母家耶？」
translation: Are you studying at your mother's house?

source_sentence: 皆曰：「當學父家。」
translation: They all said, You should study at your father's house.

source_sentence: 佛言：「如是，母賤何損？
translation: The Buddha said, So it is, what's the harm in having a lowly mother?

source_sentence: 若子長大，明經行高，踰於父者，汝加敬之。
translation: If your child grows up and becomes a man of great stature, you should pay respect to him because he surpasses his father in stature.

source_sentence: 若梵志女，為剎利婦，生子長大，知外家賢，而不肯學。
translation: Suppose a priestly woman becomes a Śāriputra's wife and gives birth to a child who grows up, knows the goodness of non-Buddhist people but won't study it.

source_sentence: 自效父家，射獵殺生，汝當敬不？」
translation: Do you respectfully serve your father's family and shoot, hunt, and kill people?

source_sentence: 皆曰：「不敬。」
translation: They all said, I don't respect them.

source_sentence: 佛言：「如是，用為問母？
translation: The Buddha said, So it is, why would you ask your mother?

source_sentence: 若使阿颰有子復賢，才秀絕世，汝當奈何？」
translation: If Akṣobhya had a son who was again wise and whose talents were so rare in the world, what would you do?

source_sentence: 皆曰：「當著上坐。」
translation: They all said, You must put it on the upper seat.

source_sentence: 「設父母俱是梵種，生子不肖，無所中直，汝當奈何？」
translation: Suppose your parents are all Brahmā, and you give birth to a child who's unworthy and doesn't have any middle ground or straightness, what will you do?

source_sentence: 皆曰：「當著下坐。」
translation: They all said, You should put it under your seat.

source_sentence: 佛言：「如是，貴是有常耶？
translation: The Buddha said, So it is, isn't it?

source_sentence: 若梵志子，殺盜犯法，吏當捕不？」
translation: If a priestly child commits killing and stealing in violation of the Dharma, will the official arrest him?

source_sentence: 曰：「當捕之。」
translation: He said, I'll arrest him.

source_sentence: 「汝何不拒，言：『我種貴，不應收捕？』」
translation: Why don't you reject it and say, 'My seeds are valuable; they shouldn't be collected?'

source_sentence: 曰：「現有罪，何得言種！」
translation: He said, If there's a sin in existence, how can it be called a seed!

source_sentence: 佛言：「今我為佛，師民仁孝，告之正言，去欲、怒、癡。
translation: The Buddha said, Now that I'm the Buddha, and my teachers and people are benevolent and filial, I tell them right words to remove desire, anger, and delusion.

source_sentence: 有常之態，諸為惡者，我輙教令，不殺、盜、婬、妄語、飲酒、祠祀事邪。
translation: Those who behave in an eternal state and commit evil deeds are taught by me to abstain from killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, speaking falsehoods, drinking alcohol, and engaging in wrongful rituals.

source_sentence: 人宿為惡，身當受罪，烹殺祠天，為過滋甚，無所補也。
translation: The human constellations are bad, and their bodies will be punished. Cultivating and killing the deities is a grave offense that cannot be remedied.

source_sentence: 且夫天意清仁，豈食人食乎？
translation: Furthermore, since the minds of gods are pure and kind, how could they eat human food?

source_sentence: 有德致祐，非殺為福。
translation: What's virtuous causes blessings, not killing as merit.

source_sentence: 是以天下賢智世主，聞佛經戒，皆自割絕，願不為惡。
translation: That is why the wise and knowledgeable ruler of the world heard the Buddha’s scriptures and precepts. All of them were cut off on their own, wishing that they would not do evil.

source_sentence: 其持戒死，精神上天；
translation: Their observance of the precepts died and they were reborn in a heavenly realm.

source_sentence: 若能至心清淨，即得沙門四道：一曰溝港、二曰頻來、三曰不還、四曰應真。
translation: If they can sincerely purify their minds, they'll attain the four paths of asceticism: first, ditching harbor, second, frequenting, third, not returning, and fourth, being true.

source_sentence: 又天下君王，雖行政欲平，亦責民租稅，貪意不除。
translation: Furthermore, even though the ruler of the empire wanted to govern with ease, he also blamed the people for paying taxes and didn't remove their craving.

source_sentence: 今我為佛，都使天下無復情欲，得無為道。
translation: Now, as a buddha, I've caused the world to become free of emotions and desires and attain the path of nonproductivity.

source_sentence: 我求道以來，其劫無數，每生有願，願棄愛欲，修沙門行，無適無莫，
translation: Countless eons have passed since I sought enlightenment, and every moment of my life has been filled with a vow to give up sensual desires and practice as a śramaṇa, neither adapting nor failing.

source_sentence: 於天下人賢明君子，聞佛經戒，靡不奉行，其不承者後皆有悔。
translation: Good men and gentlemen of the world heard the Buddha's sūtras and precepts, and they all obeyed them; those who didn't accept them later had regrets.

source_sentence: 能制意志，無復貪欲，便斷生死憂哭之道，不追相戀焉，得離苦痛。
translation: They can restrain their will and no longer have cravings, so they cut off the path of sorrow and lamentation in birth-and-death, don't pursue each other, and attain freedom from pain and suffering.

source_sentence: 天下無常，人如水泡，一成一壞，莫能自存。」
translation: The world is impermanent, and people are like bubbles of water, each forming and disintegrating, so they can't exist on their own.

source_sentence: 佛問阿颰：「汝師以何教戒？」
translation: The Buddha asked Akṣobhya, What did your teacher teach the precepts?

source_sentence: 對曰：「師戒不得殺人、殺牛，不得盜金銀，不婬師家及弟子婦，不得飲酒。
translation: He said in reply, The teacher's precept forbids killing people and killing cattle, stealing gold and silver, not licentiousing the teacher's house and his disciples or women, and not drinking alcohol.

source_sentence: 年四十八，乃得娶妻。
translation: He was forty-eight years old when he married his wife.

source_sentence: 我師教人，盡此八戒。
translation: My teacher taught people these eight precepts up to the end of their lives.

source_sentence: 未知佛戒，復何義也？」
translation: What does it mean to not know the Buddha's precepts?

source_sentence: 佛言：「樂聞者聽。
translation: The Buddha said, Those who delight in hearing will listen.

source_sentence: 若族姓子來自陳說，貪樂佛戒，我隨其能而授與戒。
translation: If a clansman comes from Chen and teaches that he desires the Buddha's precepts, I will give them to him according to his ability.

source_sentence: 欲居家修道者，名曰清信士，當持五戒：一不好殺禽獸蠕動之類，無所尅傷，
translation: Those who want to live at home and cultivate the path are called pure believers, who should observe five precepts: first, not killing birds, animals, and wriggling creatures that won't be harmed.

source_sentence: 以己況彼不加刀杖，心念為仁，口不及殺。
translation: Because he thinks of himself as kind and doesn't use a sword or stick, his mouth isn't capable of killing.

source_sentence: 二不偷盜，貪殆人財，欺斗秤尺，如圭銖分，不得侵人，心存于義，口不教取。
translation: The second is not stealing or taking what is not given. They covet people’s property and deceive the dou and weighing scales, in the same way as they cherished a small unit of money to steal [their currencies]. They keep their minds on meaningful things but did not tell others to take them by mouth.

source_sentence: 三不好欲婬犯人婦女，不觀華色，不聽好音樂，心修禮禁，言不失法。
translation: Three, they don't want to harm women who violate the precepts, don't look at flowery forms, don't listen to good music, cultivate respect and prohibition in their minds, and speak without losing the Dharma.

source_sentence: 四不妄語，譖入人罪；
translation: The fourth is the sin of not uttering falsehood, which is to slander and delude others.

source_sentence: 時而後言，言必誠信；
translation: At that moment, he said later, “I am sure I speak with sincerity.

source_sentence: 心不漏慢，口無毀譽。
translation: Their minds aren’t tainted with conceit, and their mouths don’t disparage it.

source_sentence: 五不飲酒。
translation: Five, they won't drink alcohol.

source_sentence: 縱情酗醟，心不好嗜，口無味嘗，酒有三十六失，勿以勸人。
translation: Even if they feel strong liquor and don't like it, their minds aren't fond of drinking it, and their mouths have no taste or taste, and wine has thirty-six faults, so don't encourage people to drink it.

source_sentence: 是名為我清信士之戒也。」
translation: This is called the precept of my pure faith.

source_sentence: 佛言：「我不呼人，人自來請，敬受戒，轉敷教，去惡就善。
translation: The Buddha said, I won't call anyone; people will come to ask for it themselves, respectfully accept the precepts, teach them in turn, and go from evil to good.

source_sentence: 天下賢智，欲作沙門，我每先問，何緣覺悟？
translation: Good men and wise people in the world want to become as monks, so each time I first ask, What is the reason for awakening?

source_sentence: 夫為人子，當以孝敬，安養為務。
translation: As a human child, he should be honored with filial piety and nurtured as his duty.

source_sentence: 而欲為道，當報父母。
translation: If you want to follow the path, you must repay your parents.

source_sentence: 父母聽許，然後為說沙門之戒，有二百五十，終身清淨，得無不能中道而廢，
translation: They listened to their parents’ approval and then taught them the religious precepts. There were two hundred and fifty of these precepts, which were observed for the rest of one’s life in a pure and genuine way. Those who had not renounced the world after having attained nirvana did so by following the right path.

source_sentence: 失供養恩。
translation: They'll lose the kindness of offerings.

source_sentence: 若人故請，信意不轉，堪奉法律，爾乃與戒。
translation: If someone is invited for a reason but their faith doesn't change, and they're capable of following the law, then they'll be given the precepts.

source_sentence: 沙門之戒，慈仁為本，不得殘殺蠕動之類，哀念人物，踰於赤子；
translation: The precepts of the śramaṇa are based on compassion and benevolence. They should not kill, maim, or wriggle any kind of living creatures; they should be more grieved for sentient beings than if they were children.

source_sentence: 亦不怨訟，求直於人；
translation: Nor does he hold grudges or disputes and seek to be straightforward with others.

source_sentence: 常念所生及師友恩，精進求道，欲度父母。
translation: They are always mindful of the kindnesses they've received from their teachers and friends, diligently seeking the path, and wanting to save their parents.

source_sentence: 沙門不得貪欺妄取人財，見諸寶貨，當如糞土；
translation: An ascetic should not covet or deceive people’s property. When he sees jeweled goods, he should think of them as dung and dirt.

source_sentence: 人與不受，受者不留，轉周窮乏，常為人說不貪之德。
translation: When people give it to someone who doesn't accept it, the recipient doesn't retain it, and they become poor and destitute all over. They always explain the virtue of not craving for others.

source_sentence: 沙門不得有婦繼嗣，防遠女人，禁閉情態；
translation: A śramaṇa is not allowed to have a wife who will inherit the throne. He keeps away from women and shuts off feelings of affection.

source_sentence: 行見好色，目不逆送，老者比母，次如姉妹，若心不止，當觀惡露以却婬行；
translation: When he walks, he sees a good appearance but his eyes don’t send it away. The oldest one is the closest to his mother and follows her in succession like sisters. If he doesn’t stop thinking this, he should contemplate the evil dew of filthy dirt so as to avoid coarse behavior.

source_sentence: 行起生死，皆由癡愛。
translation: Birth and death are all the result of delusion and craving.

source_sentence: 沙門不得妄言、綺語、譖入人罪，見聞如實，非義勿傳；
translation: A śramaṇa should not engage in false speech, fancy speech, or licentious deeds that offend against the precepts. He should see and hear things as they really are and not pass on what is not true.

source_sentence: 和解諍者，兩說其善；
translation: Those who resolve disputes by reconciling and explaining the goodness of both.

source_sentence: 徐言惟正，無宣人私。
translation: Xu's words were correct, and he didn't proclaim the privateness of people.

source_sentence: 沙門不得吟詠歌曲、弄舞調戱及論倡優，當勤精思溫故知新。
translation: An ascetic mustn't chant songs, play dances, regulate disputes, or discuss arguments that are strong, and he should diligently contemplate warmth and therefore know the new.

source_sentence: 沙門所說，言必法師，其所不聞，不得意造，晨夜誦經，不得謬誤，精行道要，
translation: The words spoken by the śramaṇas are bound to be those of the teacher of the Dharma. They should not hear them, and they should not make up their minds in such a way as to recite the scriptures morning and evening without error or mistake. They should practice with energy and zeal for the essentials of the path.

source_sentence: 以除眾穢，為人說法，思合義意。
translation: Because he removes all defilements, he teaches the Dharma for people and reflects on its meaning.

source_sentence: 沙門不得安臥好床，衣不文綵，食不著味，不用金銀朱漆之器，但應瓦鐵之鉢。
translation: The śramaṇas should not be allowed to lay on good beds, nor should their clothes be dyed or patterned; they should eat without wearing food that is delicious. They should not use gold, silver, red lacquer, or lacquer utensils but should accept bowls made of tile and iron.

source_sentence: 沙門不得飲酒嗜肉思嘗氣味，不得服藥酒及詣酒家。
translation: An ascetic mustn't drink alcohol, indulge in meat and contemplate its fragrance, and he mustn't take medicine or wine or go to a wine house.

source_sentence: 沙門不得以諸華香塗身、燒熏衣服，思念持戒。
translation: An ascetic mustn't rub his body with flowers and incense, burn perfumed clothing, or contemplate observing the precepts.

source_sentence: 沙門不得買使奴婢、借賃僮客，或人進與，一不得受。
translation: An ascetic mustn't buy an envoy, a servant, or a hired guest, or give it to someone else, and one shouldn't accept it.

source_sentence: 沙門不得畜養六畜、車輿騎乘快心恣意。
translation: An ascetic mustn't keep six animals, chariots, carriages, vehicles, or rides that are comfortable and unrestrained.

source_sentence: 沙門不得儲貯米穀，朝朝乞食，不過七家；
translation: The śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas should not store rice or grain. They should beg for food in the morning, but they should do so from seven houses at all.

source_sentence: 一家不得，乃到二家，匝七家不得，應但飲水。
translation: If one family doesn't get it, they go to two houses and turn around seven houses that don't get it, so they should simply drink water.

source_sentence: 沙門入聚，當如鳥食，飽而棄去，不顧其餘；
translation: The śramaṇa enters the assembly like a bird that feeds on food. Having eaten its nutriment, he leaves without concern for anything else.

source_sentence: 若不得食，心亦不恨。
translation: If they can't eat it, their minds won't hate it.

source_sentence: 沙門捨家，止不懷安，不慕好舍，其唯山澤樹下而已。
translation: The śramaṇa renounced the householder’s life and stayed away from home. He did not cherish peacefulness and he did not wish to live in an intimate dwelling, but simply lived under trees in the mountainous marshlands.

source_sentence: 沙門不得裨販求利，思念此彼何貴何賤？
translation: When an ascetic doesn't obtain profit from selling and seeking profit, he thinks, What's the value of this or that?

source_sentence: 沙門不得田廬園圃，墾殖苗稼思樂種作。
translation: An ascetic mustn't cultivate crops, plant seedlings, and consider the pleasure of planting them in a retreat or garden.

source_sentence: 沙門不得論說樂地水、香華，一心惟道，不應念餘。
translation: A monk who doesn't discuss the pleasant earth, water, and flowers of fragrance should singlemindedly contemplate the path without thinking about anything else.

source_sentence: 沙門不得議道國邑、墟聚好惡，有所高下。
translation: The śramaṇas should not discuss the good and bad aspects of different countries, towns, villages, and monasteries that are high and low.

source_sentence: 沙門不得評論同道基業、田宅、穀粮、衣食彼有此無。
translation: An ascetic mustn't comment on the existence or nonexistence of the same path in terms of basic activities, fields, homes, grains, clothing, food, and so forth.

source_sentence: 沙門不得臥談、食語，不得豫知國家政事、治軍、行師攻奪可否。
translation: An ascetic must not lie down and talk or eat, nor should he foresee the national affairs, the governance of his country, the formation of an army, or the possible attack on it by a general.

source_sentence: 沙門不得說其衣服、飲食、精美及麤泉水好惡。
translation: The ascetic should not tell them about the good and bad qualities of clothing, food and drink, delicacies, or fountains and springs.

source_sentence: 沙門不得說諸畜生形態好惡；
translation: The śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas should not teach the good or bad characteristics of animals.

source_sentence: 此愚人談，非道法語。
translation: This foolish man's talk isn't the words of the Way or the Dharma.

source_sentence: 沙門不得自稱解經，說彼不通自伐作賢，不當貢高。
translation: A monk who doesn't claim to understand the sūtras and teaches that they won't be able to subdue themselves as good men, so he shouldn't become arrogant.

source_sentence: 沙門講法，不得言我經利、汝經礙，我戒行淨、汝戒行穢；
translation: O śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas, when a bhikṣu teaches the Dharma he should not say that his doctrine is beneficial to me or disadvantageous to you. My practice of discipline is pure while your practice is impure.

source_sentence: 不得言我師明、汝師不明；
translation: You cannot say that our teacher is wise or that your teacher is not wise.

source_sentence: 佛經一統其歸無二，壯志自抗，不容毀譽；
translation: The Buddhist scriptures are unified as one, and their origins are nondual. They strive vigorously to oppose each other; they cannot criticize or disparage others.

source_sentence: 不得言我世大姓、汝種孤窶；
translation: You should not say that you belong to the great family of our world, or that you belong to the lonely class.

source_sentence: 不得自說曾與某講已不如我。
translation: You mustn't tell yourself that you didn't do as I did after giving a lecture to someone.

source_sentence: 沙門不得轉自相平某好牀机、被枕臥具某有弊疏不得照鏡摩鬚念著細滑；
translation: The śramaṇas should not turn their bodies to the sides, evenly placing themselves on a good seat or bedding that is covered with cushions. They should not illuminate mirrors, mow their hair and beards, nor touch the fine and smooth surfaces of their hair.

source_sentence: 不得觀長者鬪諸賤人及畜生鬪；
translation: They should not watch the wrestling of wealthy householders, the wrestling of lowly people, or the wrestling of animals.

source_sentence: 不得效以手拳相加；
translation: They cannot join their hands and fists to each other.

source_sentence: 不得摴蒱博奕觀效諸戲懈臥謀食，不得念到某方某郡從彼還此計其道里；
translation: They cannot go to a certain place or county, returning from that place to this one and calculating the distance of their journey.

source_sentence: 不得作男女醫及牛馬醫；
translation: They may not be physicians for men or women, cattle or horses.

source_sentence: 不得教人當吐下莫吐下；
translation: You should not tell others to spit out and not to spit down.

source_sentence: 不得習弄兵仗彈丸擲戲；
translation: They should not be accustomed to playing with weapons, shooting shells, or tossed balls.

source_sentence: 不得學相男女貧富貴賤有相無相，及相六畜儀形之狀；
translation: They cannot learn the characteristics of men and women who are poor, wealthy, noble, or humble, whether they have marks or no marks, as well as the six marks [of a buddha].

source_sentence: 不得考占水旱災變歲之豐儉。
translation: They can't account for the abundance of the floods, droughts, and calamities that change in the years.

source_sentence: 沙門不得仰觀曆數，推步日月，盈虛薄蝕，星殞變見，山崩地動，歲中風雨，
translation: The śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas did not have the power to divine the seasons, so they traveled by day and night in order to keep track of the days and months. They covered the sky with clouds and eclipsed the stars; mountains collapsed and the earth trembled, and wind and rain fell during the year.

source_sentence: 一不得知。
translation: One, they don't know.

source_sentence: 沙門過日中不得食，衣食麤疎，心不以怨，鉢常[佩-一]左脇下，其所行處，
translation: The śramaṇa was unable to eat during the day. His clothes and food were coarse and he did not cherish enemies in his mind. He always carried his almsbowl under his left hypochondrium, wherever he walked.

source_sentence: 不憂飢寒，身常與鉢俱，如鳥有翅；
translation: He did not suffer from hunger or cold, his body always accompanied by bowls like a bird with wings.

source_sentence: 口不妄食，六情常端，恥志不昇不恨身苦；
translation: Their mouths do not eat falsely, and their six senses are always straightforward. They neither feel shame or ashamed of themselves nor hold grudges against the pain of physical suffering.

source_sentence: 願在經戒目不眄色，耳鼻口身所更好惡，其心不動；
translation: “Great enlightening beings also undertake these vows: Their minds are unshakable by the scriptures and precepts; their eyes don’t see defilement, and their ears, nose, tongue, and body do not give rise to evil.

source_sentence: 節食將身不飢不飽，臥趣息體，假寐不久，抗志清邈，恒在泥洹。
translation: He ate sparingly and his body was neither hungry nor full, lying on the edge of sleep. Soon after going to sleep, he made an announcement that he wished to live in peace but always remained in nirvana.

source_sentence: 譬如孝子早喪父母，哀號思慕，無須臾忘。
translation: It's like a filial child who loses his parents early and weeps and misses them without forgetting them for a moment.

source_sentence: 斯我沙門，守志行道，坐即禪思、興則諷詠、寤寐精進、匪遑戒行。
translation: This is my ascetic, who keeps his mind on the path and practices it. When he takes his seat [to meditate] he meditates in meditation; when he rises up he recites hymns of praise; when he sleeps or lies asleep he exerts himself energetically; and when he does not fast he observes the precepts.

source_sentence: 是為佛弟子。」
translation: This is a disciple of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛告阿颰：「如此戒者，有二百五十，今粗說耳。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, There are 250 such precepts, but I'll explain them briefly.

source_sentence: 沙門攝意，不使放逸，閑居靜處，去婬怒癡，以趣智慧。
translation: The śramaṇa disciplined his mind without laziness and lived in seclusion, getting rid of lust, anger, and delusion so as to follow the path of wisdom.

source_sentence: 常用慈心，愍傷天下，捐棄眠臥貪欲之態，一心信法，不復疑惑，乃得羅漢。
translation: With a compassionate mind he always pitied all beings in the world. Rejecting their sleep and lying-in states of craving, he wholeheartedly believed in the Dharma without doubt or perplexity; thereupon he attained arhatship.

source_sentence: 羅漢者為已應真，譬如人居常貧負債，治生獲利歸畢歡喜。
translation: It's because it's true that the arhat is like a person who lives in constant poverty and debt, curing birth for profit and returning to rejoicing.

source_sentence: 復有罪人久繫獄中，有好長者方便得出。
translation: Again, there are sinners who have been tied up in prison for a long time, and there's a good elder who can skillfully escape.

source_sentence: 亦如奴婢免為良民，及病連年，醫療得愈。
translation: It's also like when a slave or maidservant is spared as a good person and his illness goes on for years, and he's cured by treatment.

source_sentence: 又如商人從澁難道得重貨歸。
translation: It's also like a merchant who returns with a heavy load of goods from the Shannon Way.

source_sentence: 此五譬喻，人皆歡喜，而我沙門，亦猶若此。
translation: These five metaphors are all rejoicing, and we as a monk are likewise.

source_sentence: 自念生死久繫五陰，更苦無量，今得解脫。
translation: He thought to himself that birth and death had long been bound to the five aggregates, and his suffering was immeasurable, so now he's liberated.

source_sentence: 何謂五陰？
translation: What are the five aggregates?

source_sentence: 一色、二痛、三想、四行、五識。
translation: One is form, two are painful, three are perceptions, four are volitions, and five are consciousnesses.

source_sentence: 此五覆人，令不見道。
translation: These five cover people so that they won't see the path.

source_sentence: 沙門自思，覺知無常，身非其身、愚癡意解，心無所著，色陰已除，是第一喜；
translation: The first delight is when a bhikṣu thinks to himself, “I perceive impermanence and know that the body is not my own body. I am not someone else’s body but [my own] body. With deluded thoughts and understanding, my mind has no attachment whatsoever. My form aggregate has been removed.

source_sentence: 沙門思念，自見身中五藏不淨，貪欲意解、善惡無二，痛陰已除，是第二喜；
translation: The second kind of delight is when the śramaṇa thinks to himself, “I see for myself that the five internal stores within my body are impure. My craving, thought, and good and evil are not two; now that I have relieved myself of the painful state of dissatisfaction.” This is the second kind of delight.

source_sentence: 沙門精思，見恩愛苦、不為漏習、無更樂意，想陰已除，是第三喜；
translation: The third kind of delight consists in the realization that a bhikṣu has relinquished the aggregate of ideation by reflecting upon the fact that he sees benevolence, affection, suffering, non-contaminated states of affliction, and no more thoughts of pleasure.

source_sentence: 沙門思惟，身口意淨、無復喜怒、寂然意定、不起不為，行陰已除，是第四喜；
translation: Fourth, when a bhikṣu observes the purity of body, speech, and mind, he no longer feels joy or anger. He is neither delighted nor displeased; this is the fourth kind of delight. Having eliminated the aggregate of volition, he enters into mental absorption in which there is no arousal or non-arising

source_sentence: 沙門自念、得佛清化、斷諸緣起、癡愛盡滅，識陰已除，是第五歡喜也。」
translation: The fifth joy is when an ascetic thinks to himself, attains the Buddha's purification, stops dependent arising, ceases delusion and craving, and removes the aggregate of consciousness.

source_sentence: 佛告阿颰：「我沙門捐棄諸欲，奉行經戒，以斷生死，則於今世，無復憂哭相戀之意。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, I as a renunciant abandoned all desires and practiced the sūtras and precepts to end birth and death, so that in this world I no longer grieved and wept with sadness.

source_sentence: 吾不貪人，人亦不貪我。
translation: I don't crave people, and people don't crave me.

source_sentence: 而吾以道慈念一切，欲使度脫。
translation: Instead, I'm mindful of all people with the compassion of the path and want them to be liberated.

source_sentence: 夫人為道，一世苦耳。
translation: A woman is the path, and it's painful in a single lifetime.

source_sentence: 不為道者，其苦彌長。
translation: Those who don't follow the path, their suffering increases.

source_sentence: 如人沐浴，但可外淨，心垢不除；
translation: Good man, it is like someone who has bathed but can only cleanse his body externally. The stain of the defilement in his mind isn’t removed.

source_sentence: 得應真者，眾惡都除。
translation: Those who attain the truth will be freed from all evils.

source_sentence: 凡人志心，道人心一如石在地，日炙不消，雨漬不釋，風吹不動，出其凡俗得成至道，
translation: Ordinary people are determined, but the mind of enlightenment is like a stone on the ground: it doesn’t disappear when scorched by the sun or when wet by rain; it doesn’t move when blown by wind. They leave their worldly ways and attain supreme enlightenment.

source_sentence: 心意已冷無復熱婬。
translation: Their minds and thoughts have become cold, and there's no more fever.

source_sentence: 譬如蓮華出於污泥，根葉常冷，塵水不著。
translation: It's like a lotus flower that emerges from dirty mud with its roots and leaves always cool, and dust and water don't cling to it.

source_sentence: 沙門自念：『父母養子，恩極一世，佛開天下，使人得道。』
translation: The ascetic thought to himself, 'My parents raised my child with the utmost kindness in a single lifetime, and the Buddha opened up the world so that people could attain enlightenment.'

source_sentence: 自見本末五道生死，知人壽命，意志已正。
translation: He saw for himself the five destinies of birth and death in the past and future, knew the human life span, and his will was right.

source_sentence: 所為自恣，欲上天即上，入海即入。
translation: He makes his own offerings, wishing to go up to heaven, he goes up; entering the sea, he enters.

source_sentence: 譬如以香盥浴死人，不能使香，教惡人善，不能必善。
translation: It's like bathing a dead person with an incense, which can't make it smell good and teaches bad people to be good but can't necessarily be good.

source_sentence: 人心惡者，身口俱惡。
translation: Bad mind and bad awarenesses are bad both bodily and verbal.

source_sentence: 外學家言，但恣則耳，無有真道；
translation: A non-Buddhist school teaches that there is no true doctrine if one follows the ways of indulgence.

source_sentence: 道人聞此，終不應答。
translation: When the monks heard this, they didn't answer it.

source_sentence: 知凡人意，想見皆倒，愚不解道，以正為邪，不別真偽。
translation: Knowing the thoughts and views of ordinary people, they're all mistaken in conceptions and views, and foolish people don't understand the path, regard right as wrong and don't discriminate between true and false.

source_sentence: 聖人愍之故加慈愛，沙門持意，如人衣新衣，坐起慎護，不欲點污。
translation: Because the sage pityed him, he became more compassionate and affectionate, and the ascetic maintained his intentions like a man wearing fresh clothes or a new one who sat up and guarded himself with caution and didn't want to defile it.

source_sentence: 故持戒者，常與心爭，使百惡來，終不聽受。
translation: That's why a person who observes the precepts always fights with his mind, causing a hundred bad people to come and never hear or accept them.

source_sentence: 父母生子，幼化以道，長犯罪死，不可怨親。
translation: A father and mother give birth to a child who is young and teaches the path, committing crimes and deaths for a long time, and they can't be enemies or relatives.

source_sentence: 譬如踞床有木無繩，不能得坐。
translation: It's like a crouching bed with wood and no rope that can't sit on it.

source_sentence: 子無明師亦不得道，如此儒士。
translation: The ignorant teacher Zi also won't attain the path, just like this Confucian man.

source_sentence: 吾前世時，多事賢聖，所受非凡，皆無為師也。
translation: In a previous life, I often served the wise and saintly. The extraordinary things I received were all uncreated teachers.

source_sentence: 得羅漢者，能自陳說，於某處得溝港、於某處得頻來及不還，至應真，
translation: Those who have attained arhatship can tell themselves, 'There's a certain place where I've found a ditch or a certain place where I've often come and won't return,' up to the point where it's true.

source_sentence: 為都解脫，不復生死。
translation: For the sake of their complete liberation, they won't go back to birth and death again.

source_sentence: 具知闊狹，如觀好畵分別五綵。
translation: It's fully known that it's wide and narrow, like observing the five distinctive colors of good paint.

source_sentence: 見天下人，皆有三毒憍慢、放逸、貪味之態。
translation: All the people in the world saw that they possessed the three poisons of arrogance, laziness, and greed.

source_sentence: 自知已解，不復貪天上生，亦不樂人中。
translation: Knowing for themselves that they’ve been liberated, they no longer crave heavenly birth and don’t delight in human beings.

source_sentence: 但念眾生，欲令解脫。
translation: They simply think of sentient beings and want to cause them to be liberated.

source_sentence: 凡人未聞，宜諦受學，如持綵絲貫瑠璃珠，五色悉現。
translation: Ordinary people who haven't heard it should listen closely and accept it, like holding a silk thread that penetrates the lapis lazuli pearl in five colors.

source_sentence: 道眼見人魂神生所從來、死趣何道，知某人死神墮地獄、某墮畜生、某墮鬼神、某入人形、某死上天。
translation: The eye of enlightenment sees where a person's soul comes from and what path the destinies of birth and death are, knowing that a certain person dies and falls into hell, a certain person falls into an animal, a certain person falls into a ghost, a certain person enters human form, and a certain person dies up in heaven.

source_sentence: 道成自知，斷此五處，已得所願，視身如土，聽取我身，破碎亦可。
translation: Knowing for himself that he had cut off these five places and had obtained what he wished, Daosun looked at his body like dirt and heard that my body would break apart as well.

source_sentence: 以明真偽，如入清水，沙礫、珠寶所有悉見。
translation: It's to clarify what's true and what's false like entering clear water, where all the rubble and jewelry are clearly visible.

source_sentence: 豫知天下，一人為百，百人為一。
translation: You should know that in the whole empire, one person is counted as one hundred and a hundred people are counted as one.

source_sentence: 所以然者？
translation: Why is this so?

source_sentence: 一人生子，轉至玄孫，興盛為百。
translation: One is to give birth to a child, which will be transformed into a mysterious grandchild and flourish as a hundred.

source_sentence: 或時百人死亡空[浿*昜]，更餘有一沙門得道，具見好惡，知何人死當生善道，
translation: “Sometimes a hundred people died in vain, while the rest of the śramaṇas who had attained enlightenment saw both good and evil. They knew which of them would be reborn in the good path if they died.

source_sentence: 亦知何人當墮惡道。
translation: He also knows which person will fall into a bad path.

source_sentence: 自見身中四氣分數，知人壽命苦樂長短。
translation: They themselves see the number of parts of the four vital forces in their bodies and know the length, pain, pleasure, and suffering of human life spans.

source_sentence: 本從不明，心識為行，行受名色，但因緣寄託，生母腹中，更相憂念，
translation: Their original origin is unknown; mind and consciousness are their modes of activity. Conditions, such as volition, sensation, name and form, but only causes and conditions entrust them to birth in one’s mother’s womb.

source_sentence: 父母言我子，子言我父母，精神展轉皆不自識。
translation: The parents say, 'I am my child,' and the child says, 'I am my parents,' but their spirits don't know themselves.

source_sentence: 宿命善者，復生為人，則富貴長壽；
translation: When the good ones of former existences are reborn as human beings, they will be rich and prosperous and have long life.

source_sentence: 其不善者，則苦短命，各由本業。
translation: When it is bad, sorrow and the short duration of life are respectively due to the former action.

source_sentence: 天地人物，一仰四氣：一地、二水、三火、四風。
translation: The gods and humans of heaven and earth have four vital principles: one is earth, two water, three fires, and four winds.

source_sentence: 人之身中，強者為地、和淖為水、溫熱為火、氣息為風，生借用此，死則歸本，
translation: In the body of a human being, earth is strong, moisture is water, heat is fire, and wind is air. Birth borrows these things for its use, and death returns to its original source.

source_sentence: 計其本末，各自為他，凡人不覺。
translation: They imagine their origin and derivative, each for the sake of others, but ordinary people don't realize it.

source_sentence: 天地之間，生者如夢，命祿至短，擾擾而死。
translation: Between heaven and earth, birth is like a dream in which the life span is so short that it's disturbed and dies.

source_sentence: 譬如風吹海水波浪相逐，生死亦然，往來無休。
translation: It's like when a wind blows the ocean water and waves chase each other, and so is birth-and-death, going and coming without rest.

source_sentence: 沙門得道，悉知天地成敗終始，一劫中事，身所更來。
translation: The śramaṇa, having attained the path of religion, knows all the formations and demises of heaven and earth as well as the final and final eons in a single kalpa. What happens is that he comes back with his body.

source_sentence: 亦知久遠無數劫事，乃知天下得道神仙，無及佛者。
translation: Knowing the events of innumerable kalpas past and future, he knows that there are gods and sages who have attained enlightenment throughout the world without equal among all buddhas.

source_sentence: 自知意志，本有萬端，今事成一，常悲眾人，為貪、欲、迷婬、怒、癡醉交亂胸中，
translation: Knowing for himself that his will originally had ten thousand parts, but now the matter has become one, he always compassionately pities those who are tormented by greed, desire, delusion, hatred, anger, and delusion in their chests.

source_sentence: 或作恩愛，不知此要。
translation: Or they may act with kindness and affection but don't know the essentials.

source_sentence: 得道達視。
translation: They'll attain the Way and be able to see it.

source_sentence: 如人鑑鏡，飛行無礙，石璧皆過。
translation: It's like the mirror of a person's mirror, which flies unobstructed, and all the stone flaps pass through it.

source_sentence: 能上須彌，手捫日月；
translation: He was able to go up the polar mountain, holding the sun and moon in his hand.

source_sentence: 能令身中別出水火；
translation: They can cause water and fire to emanate from their bodies separately.

source_sentence: 能沒地下從一方出；
translation: They can submerge the earth and emerge from one direction.

source_sentence: 能行空中坐臥自在；
translation: They can walk in the sky, sit and lie freely.

source_sentence: 能使魔王梵釋諸天，無不傾側。
translation: They can cause the Māra King, Brahmā, and other gods not to turn away from them.

source_sentence: 譬如陶家燒作瓦器盛水不漏。
translation: It's like a potter's house that burns a tile vessel and fills it with water without letting it out.

source_sentence: 凡人如坯，得道如瓦，可燥可濕，潛漬不碎。
translation: Ordinary people are like slabs, and the way they attain enlightenment is like a piece of tile that can be dried or moistened but not broken when wet.

source_sentence: 如鍛金師在作何器，得神足者，亦復如是，在所變化。
translation: Good man, it is like the case of a goldsmith who obtains supernormal abilities in whatever vessel he wishes to make.

source_sentence: 陶冶之家，欝火盛器。
translation: At the house of a potter it is said to contain a pottery vessel filled with firewood.

source_sentence: 我沙門，亦欝意成道。
translation: I, as a śramaṇa, have also earnestly sought enlightenment.

source_sentence: 如乾牛皮卷之有聲、舒亦有聲，濕以脂膏，卷舒皆軟；
translation: It is as if the skin of a dry cow’s skin were to be rolled up and stretched out in such a way that [the skin] would have sound, and so on. When moistened with grease, the rolling and stretching would all be soft.

source_sentence: 道意如是，一切柔軟，無復剛強。
translation: The aspiration for enlightenment is thus, and all things are so flexible that they're no longer rigid.

source_sentence: 譬於高樓見聞下人歌舞、鍾鼓、諸六畜聲；
translation: It is as if in a high building one saw and heard the sounds of people singing, dancing, beating bells and drums, and the six kinds of animals.

source_sentence: 道耳如是，亦聞天上音樂、亦聞餓鬼、地獄飢渴痛聲。
translation: The ears of enlightenment are like this: they also hear heavenly music, hungry ghosts and the painful sounds of hunger and thirst in hell.

source_sentence: 具見人心，有欲態者、無欲態者、有諸憙怒憎愛、愚智強弱、易化難化、好道不好道，
translation: They see the minds of those who have attitudes of desire and those who don’t have attitudes of desire; they have lust, anger, hatred, folly, ignorance, weakness, easy to teach and difficult to teach, and a good or bad path.

source_sentence: 皆分別知之，如人喜沐浴摩身不遍復更熟摩。
translation: They all discern and know them separately, just as a person who likes to bathe and moisten their body but doesn't pervade it and further moisten it.

source_sentence: 道眼觀知可度者，即持佛經，開解授與。
translation: Those who observe with the eye of enlightenment and know that they can be liberated are those who preserve the Buddha's sūtras, explain them, and give them to them.

source_sentence: 意志善者，復得為人；
translation: Good volition is to be reborn as a human being.

source_sentence: 行小高者，死得上天；
translation: Anyone who goes high or low will surely die and be reborn in heaven.

source_sentence: 若持戒淨，便得沙門四道。
translation: If he observes the precepts purely, he'll attain the four paths of asceticism.

source_sentence: 其得道者，皆知一世、十世、百世、無數世事。
translation: Those who have attained the Way know one world, ten worlds, a hundred worlds, and countless worldly affairs.

source_sentence: 亦知天地終始劫成敗時，知無數劫身所從生，彼彼時生，父母姓字彼彼時異，
translation: They also know the time of formation and decay of the heavens and earth; they know the places where bodies are born for innumerable kalpas. Their beings are born at that time and their parents’ names change according to the season.

source_sentence: 壽數多少；
translation: Their life spans are many in number.

source_sentence: 知彼時從人道上作天，從天道下作人，或從人入地獄，從地獄作畜生、作餓鬼，
translation: Knowing that at that time they become gods from the human realm upward and humans from the heavenly realm downward, or enter hell from people’s [realms of] existence as animals and hungry ghosts from the hells.

source_sentence: 從餓鬼作人，或從人復作鬼神，從鬼神入地獄上作天，悉分別知自思惟。
translation: From hungry ghosts they become humans, or from humans they become ghost spirits, and from ghost spirits they enter hell and heaven to become gods, fully discerning and thinking for themselves.

source_sentence: 如人遠客憶念故鄉，具識所有，觀見五道，自知已解。
translation: Suppose a man from a distant land remembers his hometown, knows what he has, observes the five paths, and understands for himself.

source_sentence: 道力自在，欲壽百歲、千歲、萬歲至無數劫，皆能。
translation: The power of the Way is unimpeded, and it can live as long as a hundred years, a thousand years, or ten thousand years, up to an infinite number of eons.

source_sentence: 欲不食，十日、百日、一歲、百歲，可至無數，欲食即食。
translation: If you don't want to eat it, it can be countless for ten days, a hundred days, a year, or a hundred years, and if you want to eat it, you'll eat it.

source_sentence: 如登高樓聽視下人東、西、南、北坐立語聲。
translation: It's like ascending to a high building and listening to the sounds of people who are sitting or standing, east, west, south, or north.

source_sentence: 一切聞見。
translation: All the things that are heard and seen.

source_sentence: 道人自知，意志已淨，善惡皆棄，如人好過誤犯法，吏以死狗掛頸徇令，
translation: The monks of the Way knew for themselves that their minds were pure and they abandoned both good and evil. Just as a man who liked to commit crimes committed in violation of the Dharma but did not follow the proper rules would be disciplined by an official with a dead dog hanging from his neck,

source_sentence: 其人羞慙，欲疾免離。
translation: The man was embarrassed and wanted to get rid of it quickly.

source_sentence: 得羅漢者，羞身如是。
translation: A person who attains arhatship is thus ashamed of his body.

source_sentence: 羅漢有二輩：一輩為滅、一輩為護。
translation: There are two groups of arhats: the first group is for cessation and the second group is for protection.

source_sentence: 所謂滅者，自憂得道，即取泥洹；
translation: The so-called cessation refers to the realization of the path through one’s own sorrow, that is, by taking nirvana.

source_sentence: 護者憂人，度脫天下。
translation: Those who guard it will grieve, and those who save the world will be liberated.

source_sentence: 譬如水清，其中沙石、魚鼈自現，道意已淨，悉見天下心識所有。
translation: It's like when the water is clear, sand, rocks, fish, and turtles appear on their own, and once the intention for enlightenment is purified, they all see what exists in the mind and consciousnesses of the world.

source_sentence: 沙門如是。
translation: So it is with the ascetic.

translation: How could your teacher teach and admonish you like that?

translation: “This is called the fourfold path of deluded faith.”

translation: The Buddha said, What's the length of your teacher who can serve as a teacher for the emperor and cause him to attain enlightenment?

source_sentence: 對曰：「不能。」
translation: He replied, I can't.

source_sentence: 「汝等能為太子大臣長吏作師，使得道耶？」
translation: Are you able to serve as teachers for the prince's ministers and senior officials and make them enlightened?

source_sentence: 對曰：「不能。」
translation: He replied, I can't.

source_sentence: 「汝師能教士農工商長中少年男子姤女，及令汝等皆得道乎？」
translation: Can your teacher teach you the path to all of you, whether you're young men and women in the midst of men,  farmers, merchants, or businessmen?

source_sentence: 對曰：「不能。」
translation: He replied, I can't.

source_sentence: 「汝師先祖，頗得道乎？」
translation: How could your teacher, the ancestor, have attained the Way?

source_sentence: 對曰：「不聞師教。」
translation: He replied, I haven't heard the teacher teach.

source_sentence: 「汝等趣何等道？」
translation: What path are you headed for?

source_sentence: 曰：「師言持八戒者死上梵天。」
translation: He said, The teacher says that someone who observes the eight precepts will die in Brahmā Heaven.

source_sentence: 「寧見汝輩，持是八戒，昇梵天耶？」
translation: Would you rather see your group of people who uphold these eight precepts and ascend to the Brahma heavens?

translation: He said, I've heard the teacher say so.

source_sentence: 知天下人及天上事；
translation: They know the affairs of worldly beings and celestial beings.

source_sentence: 飛行在所至到，能在能亡，能動天地，移須彌山出入無間，變化恣意；
translation: Wherever the bird flies, it can be able to move heaven and earth; moving Mount Sumeru up and down without interruption, it manifests freely.

source_sentence: 父母死亡，知墮何道，追求開導，能令解脫，子得道者，父母皆度。
translation: When their parents die, they know which path they'll fall into. They pursue and enlighten them so that they can be liberated, and when their children attain the path, their parents will all be liberated.

source_sentence: 又我沙門，持一正意，行二百五十戒，就無為道。」
translation: Furthermore, I as an ascetic maintain one correct intention and practice the 250 precepts in order to follow the path of nonproductivity.

source_sentence: 佛告阿颰：「我棄國捐王，行作沙門，憂斷生死，今得自然，為如來、至真、等正覺、明行成為、善道、世間解、無上士、道法御、天人師，
translation: The Buddha said to Ānanda: Having renounced the kingdom and gone forth to become a śramaṇa, I grieve over having abandoned birth and death. source_sentence: 号佛、眾祐，都為天上天下作師，其持我經戒，無不得道者。
translation: The names Buddha and Samantabhadra are all teachers for the gods in heaven and earth, and there's no one who doesn't attain enlightenment if they uphold my sūtras and precepts.

source_sentence: 我常慈心，教化天下，去惡就善。
translation: I am always compassionate, teaching and edifying the world, getting rid of evil and doing good.

source_sentence: 善可常行，惡不可久，苦可長處，樂不可保，樂者當時快意，久後受苦，
translation: Good deeds can always be done; evil cannot last for a long time. Suffering can last for a long time, and happiness cannot be preserved. The blissful one is happy at the moment but experiences suffering after a long time.

translation: There's nothing beyond repentance when the sin arrives.

translation: Ānanda then looked at the Buddha's body and thought, There are thirty-two characteristics of the Buddha, but why don't I see one characteristic?

source_sentence: 佛知其意，即為出舌，先舐左耳，却舐右耳，復舐髮際，以舌覆面，徐引舌下。
translation: Knowing what he meant, the Buddha produced his tongue and licked his left ear first, then his right ear, again licked its end, covered his face with his tongue, and slowly pulled it down.

source_sentence: 阿颰歎曰：「如佛者難值，萬世時有舌相乃爾，安得不知？」
translation: Akṣobhya praised him, Suppose a buddha is difficult to meet, and there's a tongue that exists for all time, so how could he not know it?

source_sentence: 佛言：「汝等來久，歸謝汝師。」
translation: The Buddha said, You've been here long enough to thank your teacher.

source_sentence: 五百人皆前接佛足而去。
translation: The five hundred people came forward, touched the Buddha’s feet, and departed.

source_sentence: 費迦沙乘車而出，見諸弟子來，即住待之，諸弟子至，下車作禮。
translation: When he saw the disciples coming, he stayed and waited for them. When the disciples arrived, he dismounted from the chariot to pay his respects.

source_sentence: 師言：「瞿曇沙門，名聞天下，有其相乎？
translation: The teacher said, Does the Gautama ascetic have any characteristics that are known in the world?

source_sentence: 住何以久，盡說何事？」
